intro: Ancylotropis malmeana, commonly known as the Malme's sandburs, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, spiny fruit pods. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Ancylotropis malmeana is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal dunes.
